title: Flying lotus and kemistry typeface id please?
content:
Hi

Can anyone help me id these two typefaces please....

The first one is an elegant serif, that one of my local galleries have used for an exhibition flyer...

The second one is a dotted sans serif that feels like its based on avant garde / century gothic , but the g dimensions are different from both.

This is the first post i have done on this site as i joined a week ago - i think its a really good idea to share information on design and i will try my best to help other people as well

- thankyou for setting the site up.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081030001129/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%201_63.jpg) | 48.92 KB |
| [retro\_one2.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081030001129/http:/typophile.com/files/retro_one2.jpg) | 167.94 KB |

 [‹ Victorian book font, unsure if it's called 'Farmer Market' ??](http://web.archive.org/web/20081030001129/http:/typophile.com/node/36693 "Go to previous forum topic") [ID: Modern "PowerHaus" ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081030001129/http:/typophile.com/node/49416 "Go to next forum topic")
author: commonprojects

comments.content: The elegant serif face is [Sabon](http://web.archive.org/web/20081030001129/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/monotype/monotype_sabon_pro_virtual/); the st-ligature tells us it’s the [Next](http://web.archive.org/web/20081030001129/http:/www.linotype.com/53159/sabonnext-family.html) version.
thankyou! thats a new serif to me i will look that up, just have to wait for the id on the other now....
